page.title: 18Old People's Home.
page.content: The Home,called Hunter's Lodge,is in Church Lane and was originally the stables for Dalby Hall Estate.The old buildings were converted in 1983 at a cost of Â£250,000 into an attractive stone building with windows looking out over the village. The Home is privately run and at the moment has 32 residents with the oldest person being 95.It provides a lot of part time work in the village, particularly for women. Children from our primary school often visit the Home and entertain the old people with songs,dance and drama.Some of the more mobile old people come to functions at the school.The Scouts and Guides run an "Adopt a Granny"scheme and some of them pay weekly visits to a particular old person.The local church also has a similar scheme.
